architecture_and_diagram_goals.title: UML Component Diagram – Crew-7 Platform Infrastructure
architecture_and_diagram_goals.copilot_prompt:
Act as a senior software architect for the Crew-7 project.

Goal: Create a high-level UML Component Diagram (in React + SVG or existing UI primitives) that visually explains the main backend + infra architecture of Crew-7.

IMPORTANT:
- Do NOT break any existing pages or styles.
- Follow the existing dark / neon / blueprint aesthetic.
- Add, don’t replace: keep all current content, just extend the Technology section of the pitch deck.

Diagram type:
- UML Component Diagram (high level overview).

Components to include (each as a labeled box/component node):
1) User / Browser Client
2) Web Server / Frontend App
   - Tech: React/Next.js (or current AI Studio–generated frontend), anime.js for visuals, XYFlow/ReactFlow for graphs.
3) API Gateway / Backend API
   - Tech: FastAPI (or current Python backend), REST + WebSocket + SSE.
4) Orchestrator Service
   - Responsible for coordinating crew runs, talking to CrewAI, and routing between agents.
5) Run & Trace Service
   - Stores run records, events (agent_start, agent_end, tool_call, tool_result, error), and exposes them via API for chat + graph.
6) Memory Service
   - Qdrant vector store client used for crew_memory_{crew_id} and mission_memory_{mission_id}.
7) Marketplace Service
   - Handles crew templates, listing/installing prebuilt crews.
8) Artifact Service
   - Manages generated code, tests, docs, build artifacts (stored in filesystem or object storage).
9) Database (PostgreSQL)
   - Stores users, orgs, crews, runs, traces metadata, marketplace templates, settings.
10) Cache / Message Bus (Redis)
    - For caching, pub/sub for live events, WebSocket broadcast.
11) LLM Providers
    - Gemini (for Orchestrator)
    - aimalapi models (for specialists; multiple models: backend, frontend, QA, DevOps, etc.).
12) Optional Web3 / Token Layer
    - Simple box representing future on-chain reputation + payments (e.g. C7T utility token, reputation tokens).

Relationships / flows (draw directional arrows, with brief labels):
- User Browser -> Web Server: "HTTPS requests".
- Web Server -> API Gateway/Backend API: "REST / WebSocket / SSE".
- API Gateway -> Orchestrator Service: "Start crew run / control commands".
- Orchestrator Service -> Run & Trace Service: "log events, run state".
- Orchestrator Service -> Memory Service (Qdrant): "add_memory / search_memory".
- Orchestrator Service -> Marketplace Service: "load crew template" (for prebuilt crews).
- Orchestrator + Specialists -> LLM Providers: "LLM calls (Gemini, aimalapi)".
- Backend services -> PostgreSQL: "read/write metadata".
- Backend services -> Redis: "cache + event bus".
- Artifact Service -> Storage (can be drawn as a simple box): "save/load generated files".
- Web Server -> Run & Trace Service + Artifact Service: "fetch events + artifacts for UI".

Style:
- Dark theme background (matching existing blueprint landing).
- Boxes with subtle glow, rounded corners.
- Lines with soft glowing edges.
- Small arrowheads, minimal text labels.

Implementation details:
1) Create a reusable React component, e.g. <InfraComponentDiagram /> that renders this UML-style schematic using SVG.
2) Make it responsive and fit nicely inside the Technology section card/container.
3) Wrap the SVG in a clickable thumbnail: on click, open a full-screen modal with a zoomed version.
4) Modal requirements:
   - Dark backdrop.
   - Close icon (top-right) + ESC key support.
   - Zoom support (either CSS scale + pan or simple larger fixed rendering that fits the screen).

Finally, integrate this diagram into the presentation/pitch-deck Technology section:
- Locate the Technology/Stack section in the existing HTML pitch deck.
- Extend its content container and insert the diagram under a heading like "System Architecture (Component View)".
- Keep existing text but add a short caption under the diagram.

architecture_and_diagram_goals.title: Agentic AI Structure – Orchestrator + 6 Specialists + Tools
architecture_and_diagram_goals.copilot_prompt:
Act as a senior AI systems architect.

Goal: Create a detailed visual diagram (React + SVG or existing graph components) that explains the internal Agentic AI structure used by Crew-7.

Do NOT remove or break existing Agent Graph UI. Add a new, static explanatory diagram for the Technology section in the pitch deck.

Diagram type:
- Conceptual multi-agent architecture diagram (not runtime, more explanatory).

Elements to include:
1) One central Orchestrator node:
   - Label: "Orchestrator (Gemini)".
   - Tags: "Planning", "Task decomposition", "Coordination", "Memory-aware".
2) Six specialist nodes around it, each represented as a robot/agent icon with role:
   - Backend Architect (aimalapi)
   - Backend Implementer (aimalapi)
   - Frontend Architect (aimalapi)
   - Frontend Implementer (aimalapi)
   - QA / Test Engineer (aimalapi)
   - DevOps / Infra Engineer (aimalapi)
3) Memory node (Qdrant) off to the side:
   - With arrows to/from Orchestrator and optionally specialists (read-only arrows from specialists).
4) Tool layer beneath the agents:
   - Each specialist connected to 1–3 tools only (ideal for high performance):
     * Backend: Code writer, schema designer, API tester.
     * Frontend: UI generator, assets/layout helper, API client generator.
     * QA: Test generator, coverage analyzer, checklist builder.
     * DevOps: Dockerfile generator, CI pipeline writer, deployment config helper.
   - Make it clear visually that each agent has a small set of focused tools (1–3) instead of a huge toolbox.
5) Communication model:
   - Orchestrator ↔ Specialists (centralized coordination).
   - Optional direct edges between some specialists (e.g. Backend ↔ Frontend, Backend ↔ QA) to represent hybrid/peer communication.
   - Arrow labels like "task assignment", "status update", "API contract clarification".

Style:
- Dark background, clean neon/blueprint lines.
- Agent nodes with small robot avatars consistent with Crew-7 look.
- Clear ring around the Orchestrator.

Implementation details:
1) Build a React component, e.g. <AgenticStructureDiagram /> using SVG or simple positioned divs.
2) Make it static (not live data-driven), purely for explanation in the Technology/Architecture part of the pitch.
3) Include a small legend: Orchestrator color, Specialist color, Memory, Tools.
4) Wrap it like the infra diagram: clickable thumbnail + full-screen zoomable modal.

Integration:
- In the pitch deck Technology section, extend the content container and add a subsection like "Agentic AI Structure".
- Add a short explanatory paragraph under the diagram that aligns with the current narrative: 1 Orchestrator + 6 Specialists, hybrid communication, memory via Qdrant, 1–3 tools per agent for focus.

architecture_and_diagram_goals.title: Crew Structure, Tools & Communication Diagram
architecture_and_diagram_goals.copilot_prompt:
Goal: Visualize how one concrete Crew-7 team (e.g. the Full-Stack SaaS Crew) is structured, how tasks flow, and how tools are used.

Type:
- High-level workflow/sequence diagram style, but drawn as a schematic timeline/flow diagram.

Key requirements:
1) Represent one mission lifecycle:
   - User defines mission → Orchestrator plans → Specialists execute tasks → Results aggregated → Artifacts produced.
2) Main swimlanes or columns:
   - User
   - Orchestrator
   - Backend Agents
   - Frontend Agents
   - QA Agent
   - DevOps Agent
   - Tools/Infrastructure
3) Along the horizontal axis (time), show key steps:
   - T0: User submits mission.
   - T1: Orchestrator reads Qdrant memory (if any) + plans tasks.
   - T2: Backend/Frontend architects propose designs.
   - T3: Implementers generate code and push artifacts to Artifact Service.
   - T4: QA agent generates tests.
   - T5: DevOps prepares Docker/CI.
   - T6: Orchestrator reviews, summarizes, and sends result to user.
4) Under each step, show which tools are called (icons or small labels) and which infra components are touched (DB, Redis, Qdrant, LLMs).

Style:
- Dark, minimal, clean.
- Use simple icons or subtle shapes; don’t overload text.

Implementation:
- Create <CrewWorkflowDiagram /> React component.
- Use flex + SVG or just SVG to draw swimlanes and arrows.
- Support modal zoom on click so judges can inspect details.

Integration:
- Add this under a section in the presentation like "How a Crew-7 Mission Runs".
- Extend the Technology or Architecture slide content container to fit this diagram and a short caption.

architecture_and_diagram_goals.title: Tech Stack – DB, Backend, Frontend, LLMs, Security, Web3
architecture_and_diagram_goals.copilot_prompt:
Goal: Create a clean, high-level Tech Stack diagram for the pitch deck Technology section, aligned with the Crew-7 implementation.

Stack layers (vertical or horizontal columns):
1) Data Layer:
   - PostgreSQL (primary relational DB)
   - Qdrant (vector DB for memory)
   - Optional Object Storage (for artifacts)
2) Backend Layer:
   - FastAPI (or current Python API backend)
   - CrewAI (agent orchestration framework)
   - Qdrant client library
   - Redis (cache / message bus)
3) Frontend Layer:
   - React/Next.js (or AI Studio–generated frontend base)
   - XYFlow/ReactFlow (Agent Graph)
   - anime.js (geometry + blueprint animations)
   - Custom dark/blueprint UI components
4) AI / LLM Layer:
   - Gemini (Orchestrator model)
   - aimalapi models (specialists – different models per role)
   - LLM connection manager (configurable providers + API keys)
5) Security Layer:
   - Auth (JWT/session, org/workspace separation)
   - Encrypted secret storage for LLM keys + env vars
   - Sandbox for tools (resource limits, restricted FS/network)
6) Web3 Layer (optional/future):
   - Tokenization of crews (C7T utility, reputation tokens)
   - Marketplace payment & ownership rails

Style:
- Dark background, clean grid-like layout.
- Each layer is a row or column with a label and contained tech badges.

Implementation:
- Create <TechStackDiagram /> React component.
- Use simple cards/boxes with icons/text; no white backgrounds.
- Add modal zoom support like other diagrams.

Integration:
- Replace the simple Technology bullet list in the pitch deck Technology section with:
   - Short intro paragraph.
   - This Tech Stack diagram.
   - Keep existing text content but reorganize it around this visual.

architecture_and_diagram_goals.title: Upgrade Pitch Deck Technology Section with Diagrams + Zoom
architecture_and_diagram_goals.copilot_prompt:
You now have several React diagram components (InfraComponentDiagram, AgenticStructureDiagram, CrewWorkflowDiagram, TechStackDiagram). Integrate them into the existing Crew-7 pitch deck HTML/React without breaking anything.

Tasks:
1) Locate the Technology/Stack section in the pitch deck we already use for Crew-7 (the one based on the CodeFlow template that we adapted).
2) Extend that section’s content container so it can hold:
   - A short textual intro.
   - Multiple subsections:
     * System Architecture (Component View)
     * Agentic AI Structure
     * Mission Workflow (Crew-7 example)
     * Tech Stack Overview
3) For each subsection:
   - Add a heading.
   - Add 2–3 sentences of explanation (reuse the long description and architecture texts we drafted; keep it concise).
   - Render the corresponding diagram component.
4) For each diagram component:
   - Show a medium-size version inline.
   - Add click-to-zoom: when the user clicks the diagram, open a full-screen modal with an enlarged version.
   - Modal must:
     * Dark overlay.
     * Centered diagram.
     * Close button + ESC key + backdrop click to close.
5) Respect the existing global styling:
   - Dark background only, no white sections.
   - Keep fonts, colors, and spacings consistent with the current deck.
6) Do NOT remove any existing slides or text. Only enhance the Technology-related slide/section.

Non-breaking requirement:
- If any diagram component fails to render, the deck must still load and show at least the text. Wrap diagrams in error boundaries or simple conditional rendering.

Goal: Judges can open the Technology slide, see a clean, extended section with four visuals and short descriptions, and click each visual to zoom in and inspect architecture/agent structure/tech stack in detail.
